Huanggang Port Parking and Cross-Border Tips | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

Hey, parking at the Huanggang Port is quite convenient — but since it’s late at night, remember safety first.

If you’re in Shenzhen, don’t rush to drive there. It’s much easier to just take a direct cross-border bus from Futian or Luohu to Hong Kong — no need to worry about parking or customs yourself.

The Huanggang Port (the Shenzhen–Hong Kong border port) has a parking lot on the east side of the joint inspection building, with the entrance turning in from Huanggang Road. It’s very easy to spot — just search for “Huanggang Port Parking Lot” in your navigation app.

During daytime peak hours, the first hour costs 10 RMB, then 5 RMB per half hour after that. At night it’s cheaper, and parking under 15 minutes is free.

But note: after crossing the border, you can’t directly drive your car into Hong Kong — you’ll need paperwork for cross-border driving or to leave the car with someone on the mainland side.

I’d suggest you just take the Huanggang cross-border bus tonight — it’s open 24 hours and gets you to Mong Kok or Wan Chai really fast.

Alternatively, you can go via Shenzhen Bay Port, which uses a “one place, two inspections” system; metro and buses go directly to the Hong Kong airport from there.
